instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: no backlight on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with no backlight. No known liquid damage. 

F9700 is good.

Have 11.09V on and .597 diode mode measurement <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>
Have 3.2V on <SIGNAL>P3V3_LCDVDD_SW_F</SIGNAL>
Have 3.3V on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_LCD_F</SIGNAL>

Any idea why I don't have backlight? 
Thanks

threads.title: no backlight on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>?? also 11.09V only battery i guess, if you have this voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> means no boosting, check feedback trace.....

threads.title: no backlight on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
no backlight on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
2.75V on <SIGNAL>BKL_ENL</SIGNAL> (measured on PIN 2 of <RESISTOR>R9715</RESISTOR>)

Will check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> right now
